1.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
repose or (adverbially) peacefully; figuratively, consolation (specifically, matrimony); hence (concretely) an abode
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

2.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, to twist as arope;  to bound (as by a line)
Tsidon, the name of a son of Canaan, and of a place in Palestine
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be wise (in mind, word or act)
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

3.brief: something hemming in, i.e. (objectively) a mound (of besiegers), (abstractly) a siege, (figuratively) distress; or (subjectively) a fastness
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
properly, incised or (active) incisive; hence (as noun masculine or feminine) a trench (as dug), gold (as mined), a threshing-sledge (having sharp teeth); (figuratively) determination; also eager
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors

4.brief: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

5.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

6.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a mongrel, i.e. born of aJewish father and aheathen mother
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a Pelishtite or inhabitant of Pelesheth

7.brief: blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
disgusting, i.e. filthy; especially idolatrous or (concretely) an idol
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
properly, to swell up, i.e. be (causatively, make) redundant
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
familiar; a friend, also gentle; hence, a bullock (as being tame; applied, although masculine, to a cow); and so, a chieftain (as notable, like neat cattle)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
a Jebusite or inhabitant of Jebus

8.brief: properly, to incline; by implication, to decline (of the slanting rays of evening); specifically, to pitch atent; gen. to encamp (for abode or siege)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to drive (an animal, a workman, a debtor, an army); by implication, to tax, harass, tyrannize
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

9.brief: properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
lo!
a king
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
just
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
depressed, in mind or circumstances
to ride (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to place upon (for riding or generally), to despatch
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a male ass (from its dun red)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a young ass (as just broken to a load); hence an ass-colt
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a female donkey (from its docility)

10.brief: to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

11.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

12.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
properly, a repetition, i.e. a duplicate (copy of a document), or a double (in amount); by implication, a second (in order, rank, age, quality or location)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

13.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)

Javan, the name of a son of Joktan, and of the race (Ionians, i.e. Greeks) descended from him, with their territory; also of a place in Arabia
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

14.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
the south (as being on the right hand of a person facing the east)

15.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to tread down; hence, negatively, to disregard; positively, to conquer, subjugate, violate
a sling; also a (door) screen (as if slung across), or the valve (of the door) itself
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
an angle (as projecting), i.e. (by implication) a corner-column (or anta)

16.brief: properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

17.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, selected, i.e. a youth (often collective)
must or fresh grape-juice (as just squeezed out); by implication (rarely) fermented wine
to germinate, i.e. (figuratively) to (causatively, make) flourish; also (of words), to utter
a virgin (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a bride; also (figuratively) a city or state
